sentences.english: I'm fine, just a little down.
sentences.chinese: 我很好，只是有些意興闌珊。

sentences.english: Looked at the lights outside the car felt the first time found that all very strange.
sentences.chinese: 看着車外的燈火闌珊，第一次發覺所有很陌生。

sentences.english: Night decayed, a desk lamp, return yellow books depicting handwriting has light.
sentences.chinese: 夜闌珊，一盞檯燈下，返黃書箋筆跡已淡。

sentences.english: On the other hand, the incense to operate MiPu exclusively.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，金香對經營米鋪意興闌珊。

sentences.english: Quaint shops still has its lights.
sentences.chinese: 古雅的小店依舊燈火闌珊。

sentences.english: The night waned , and I worked hastily, but in silence.
sentences.chinese: 夜色闌珊，我麻利地忙活着，當然是悄無聲息。

sentences.english: Disturbed the night to sing to sing the dim light the lower levels become out of my mind sad recollections.
sentences.chinese: 夜唱忐忑唱燈火闌珊下情已成追憶傷感出我的心聲。

sentences.english: In a quiet afternoon, the hotness made all people looked wan.
sentences.chinese: 一個寂靜的下午，天氣熱的讓所有的人都意興闌珊。

sentences.english: People sitting on the steps of an illuminated Khaju Bridge at night.
sentences.chinese: 晚間，人們坐在燈火闌珊哈鳩橋的臺階。

sentences.english: Many inside look for its 1000100 degreeses, suddenly look back, that person but in the lights decayed place.
sentences.chinese: 衆裏尋它千百度，驀然回首，那人卻在燈火闌珊處。

sentences.english: Perhaps that is myself in the blaze of light.
sentences.chinese: 也許那就是在燈火闌珊處的自己。

definition: to rustle in the air/to rustle/to sough/bleak/desolate/chilly
(literary) crisscross/uneven/disorderly/rim of the eye/variant of 欄杆|栏杆[lan2 gan1]
Lord of the East, the sun God of Chinese mythology
to flicker/to flash on and off/to brighten and fade
to fall and wither (like autumn leaves)/(fig.) drifting and homeless
